content: the australian sheep and wool show is held in bendigo victoria during july of each year avid crafters know it by the nickname *spendigo* due to the vast amount of shopping that takes place by the thousands of attendees at the 3 day event ~~~~~~ this is a snug fitting beanie because that is how i prefer to wear them try knitting in worsted instead if you prefer a slightly looser fit ~~~~~~ this relatively simple design is worked in two colours with or without corrugated ribbing and finishing with a pinwheel-style textured crown or not begin and finish with written instructions though the main colourwork pattern is fully charted i have also provided a greyscale chart for you to try your own colours in advance of knitting as well as the chart showing light and dark in reverse **yarn** any dk weight yarn pure wool being my preferred choice the maroon/beige sample shown used yarn produced only a few kilometres from the location of the sheep & wool show colour a light appx 45 metres colour b dark appx 72 metres **needles** 3 5mm and 4 00mm 40cm circulars 4 00mm dpn s for the crown **notions** one stitch marker tapestry needle for weaving in ends **skills required** corrugated two colour ribbing stranded colourwork knit from a chart purl 2 decrease knit 2 decrease please use hashtag #spendigo2024 if sharing on social media
